headline: Classic Rice Pilaf
description: Oven-baked rice pilaf is a tasty and foolproof alternative to plain rice. And you don't need a rice cooker — this comes out fluffy and tender every time.

video.description: Never make sticky, mushy rice again!
video.name: Classic Rice Pilaf

name: Classic Rice Pilaf

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Melt butter and oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until lightly browned, 7 to 8 minutes. Remove from the heat.
Place rice into a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Add onion and stir until rice is thoroughly coated. Place the dish on a baking sheet.
Combine chicken stock, salt, cayenne pepper, and saffron in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
Pour stock mixture over rice in the baking dish and stir to combine. Spread mixture evenly along the bottom of the pan and cover tightly with heavy-duty aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to rest, covered, for 10 minutes. Remove the foil and fluff rice with a fork.

review.reviewBody: WOW! So impressed with this easy to make recipe. Did not have saffron, or turmeric as some suggested, so that was omitted. It was still wonderful and flavorful. Husband is not much of a rice fan, but even he liked it. It made enough to have leftovers for tonights dinner. Will definitely make again with the saffron.
The best rice recipe! I usually add turmeric or garlic instead of saffron.
My new way to cook rice! Added some garlic powder instead of the cayenne and omitted the saffron. Perfect!
I liked it alot. Received complimentary responses on it. Made it with turmeric instead of saffron. Didn't have saffron. I liked the favor and the color it gave the rice.

Perfect as it is. The first time I made it I even sprung for the saffron. It has become a staple here with a few changes. I add garlic and mushrooms with the onions, canned or fresh. (If canned mushrooms, I drain off the water and dice them to match the onions.) Skip the saffron and chili flakes but while the broth/stock (whichever I have at the time) is simmering I add a little onion powder, a little garlic powder, maybe a 1/2 tsp or so paprika and some parsley for color. I may also dice in some cooked shredded chicken or sliced smoked sausage. I've even tossed in 1/2 cup or so of frozen peas to the broth a couple times. With the additions I will usually go 375 for 40-45 minutes then the 10 minute rest. My son and I also like sprinkling some soy sauce on our portions. If you actually read that whole speech my main point is this, you can do anything with this and it's awesome!

This is really amazing. I did make a couple of changes - After putting the onion in the butter, I added the rice to the onion and butter to put a light toast on the rice. Instead of chicken stock, I used Better than Bouillion veggie base and omitted the extra rice (it isn't necessary imho). Put everything together in a baking dish and baked according to the directions. I will make this again for sure.

This rice dish turned out perfectly! It was delicious and comforting, pairing well with baked salmon with lemon cream sauce and roasted asparagus. The texture was great, not sticky or soggy at all. The only change I made was that I didn't have saffron so added a pinch of turmeric instead, to give that slight golden hue. I also decreased the salt by 1/4 teaspoon as I was worried it would be too salty with the chicken broth. Our teen-aged kids both enjoyed this as did one of their friends who had 3 servings! :)
This is my hubs fav. I’ve made this recipe several times. Sometimes I half it and it comes out just as good. We prefer using bouillon cubes to chicken broth and eliminate extra salt.

Excellent recipe, and easy customize.

My no stove top/method:
I have don't use any pots on the stove (I don't use raw onions). I melt/heat the butter/oil in the baking pan while preheating the oven and use a measuring cup for the hot liquids and seasoning.
A wonderful recipe!!! I didn’t put onion in it & I didn’t have saffron. It will be a great go to recipe for me.
I followed this recipe exactly as written. I was so surprised at how much flavor and baking it created the perfect side dish! We all loved it!
Just your basic rice dish with the addition of saffron, which in all honesty didn't make much difference to the taste.
Prepared as directed and it was perfectly cooked. I love how easy this was to prepare.

It was perfect rice pilaf.

I added some leftover fresh mushrooms and it was fantastic.
Did not add saffron. Guests late so it warmed in oven 45 minutes. Had a little kick. Was a HUGE hit and favorite thing in meal with tuna steaks, shrimp app, and fried beans.

It was good and my husband liked it. Was out of onion so used a red onion, however it was a bit strong. Cut it down to 4 servings and that worked well. I probably could have cooked it a little longer due to my altitude.
Perfect every time!!!

Simple delight! I was so surprised at the difference technique made. The texture is so light and wonderful. The only change is I didn't have saffron so I substituted a clove of garlic. I served with wild ginger salmon (from this site) and fresh green beans on the side.
Simple, delicious. A family favorite
Recipe nice and straight forward, I also added 1/4 cup of shredded carrots to the last step for color.

I didn't have saffron so I omitted that. Delicious nonetheless. I did use fresh hot peppers with the onions when frying so didn't add the cayenne. Enough spice was with my fresh hot red peppers! Loved this dish

Our family loves this recipe! Our toddler really likes mushroom so I added 3 cups of chopped mushrooms with the onions. I added 1/2 tsp of salt to the mushroom and onion mix and 1/4 tsp of salt to the chicken stock. I omitted the cayenne pepper and didn't boil the chicken stock. The rice turned out great! Highly recommend this recipe!
It was good

THE BEST RICE EVER! have been making this recipe for years and just now got around to reviewing it. I make it exactly as written and it's completely fool-proof. It yields perfect, delicious rice pilaf every single time.
Loved this recipe. It had lots of flavour and easy to make in a pinch. I didn't have saffron, but it still tasted really nice.
Excellent recipe! I have made it several times and will continue to use it as my go-to rice dish.

I love this recipe and make it often. I sauté the rice with the butter/onion mixture and add some diced frozen peas and carrots. I don’t usually have saffron Since it’s so expensive, so I add about a 1/4 tsp of turmeric which gives it a nice yellow color.
The recipe is perfect as is and I've made it several times. Great dish!

I loved this recipe. Seemed weird at first but the oven method worked perfectly and was nice to fix, put in the oven and concentrate on the rest of the meal. I used basmati rice- if you haven't tried it you should- and left out the cayenne. This was delicious!!!!!
One of my favorite go to dishes. I like to double the cayenne pepper for a more robust spice.
added sliced mushrooms and diced chicken
I love this recipe. I did one and a half the recipe to feed 10 people and it turned out perfectly. I didn’t have saffron but I think it’s very good without it.

Wonderful. I don't like onion, so I use a couple of cloves of minced garlic instead, then sprinkle a teaspoon or so (I don't measure) of onion powder in too. I make this rice a couple of times a week, usually. It's foolproof.

This was an easy and delicious recipe. I made this to accompany a baked cod dish and they were perfect together. I omitted the saffron, added a little more onion, reduced the salt & cayenne by half and increased the broth to 3.5 cups. Baked it in a 9x13 glass casserole dish and it came out amazingly! I look forward to having this again!
Super easy, my family loved it!!!
I made this rice tonight. Followed recipe to a T. What I got was under cooked rice. So disappointing. It tasted pretty good but don’t think I’ll try it again

Best rice ever! I actually browned the onions (cause I was looking at another recipe) and it enhanced the flavour and the presentation. Husband is a rice fanactic and loved it! Served it with broiled scallops and left over beef stroganoff. Followed recipe to a TEE
Made it just as written and it was perfect!

This turns out perfectly every time I make it and I like that I don't need to sit at the stove watching it. I've made it mostly as written except I didn't have cayenne on hand so I used a little Aleppo pepper instead. I also use jasmine rice as that is all I keep on hand for white rice and I really would recommend that or a basmati. I also recommend a good quality bone broth or stock as it really makes a difference in flavor. The rice has great flavor while also being mild enough that it could pair with almost anything well.
Absolutely perfect.

I've been making this "sorta" for a few years. By "sorta" I mean skipping many of the steps. I recently started making Risotto and wanted to make it with some fresh Coho salmon tonight but didn't have the time so, I went to this recipe and reread every detail. I almost followed every step :/ only skipped the oven and did it on the stove top. This turned out very close to a Risotto! I also substitute Turmeric(poor mans Saffron) for the Saffron in most recipes unless it's a really special meal. Thanks Chef John I will never question you again. :)
Turned out great . Didn’t have saffron so I used Sazon and a bit of Adobos seasoning. Excellent.
I've been making this recipe for years. It has become my go to rice for a crowd dish. Easy, and delicious!!
This is awesome! Very easy and it turned out perfect. I did use cilantro instead of the other spices because that is what I had and it was good. Will definitely do it again!

Doubled & cooked in slow cooker. Sautéed onion in skillet, then added to slow cooker. Browned rice in butter then added to slow cooker. Used low sodium box of chicken broth + can of chicken broth. Added 1 package Sazon con Goya and heated to boiling in microwave. Poured into slow cooker and added a sheet of foil under lid to keep more steam inside. Cooked on low 1.5 hours and I didn’t burn it like I normally do! Light & fluffy, but needed more salt. So easy and a real keeper!

I’ve made this many times and it always comes out perfect! The rice is fluffy and flavorful. I add turmeric instead of saffron, which gives the rice a beautiful yellow color. I also throw in a handful of frozen peas and carrots or mixed veggies for more color.

I change ingredients all the time depending on what I am making... but the original is the best. Most often, I just make plain rice. Now that I live at 3000 ft, I have lost my ability to cook rice correctly;) Cheers Chef John! I just realized that I’ve been following your recipes for years now. Thank you!

It was foolproof and turned out amazing. The green onions on top added a nice touch. I used Basmati Rice instead of long grain rice and it was fluffy and moist. Next time I am going to mix it up and add chopped mushrooms.
Excellent method! Thanks!
Followed the recipe as written except I halved it for the two of us. Good even left over

This recipes was very basic and very good! I love how it baked in the oven. I followed the directions exactly but added only 1 tsp. of salt because there was salt in my chicken stock. Each grain was separate (not that it matters to me), and the texture was perfect. Next time I might add some slivered almonds and a little parsley at the end.
I skipped the saffron simply because I didn't have any. My family and I loved this recipe! Lots of flavour! I will definitely make this again.

Yes, indeed, this is the best rice! I've made it 4 times. DO add the saffron! I use about 1/2 tsp. That's what makes this dish sing! It's so cool to bake the rice and not have to worry about it sticking to the bottom of the pan.
I forgot the cayenne!

Used basmati rice which may not have cooked as well as a regular rice, leaving it a bit chewier. After letting it sit for 10 minutes, I fluffed it and let it sit for another 30min. Texture didn’t really change, however, my husband and I loved it! The flavour Is delicious... so glad we get to have leftovers!

I made this rice as a side dish to baked fish for a birthday dinner. It turned out perfect! Everyone loved it! My husband said it was the best rice he has ever had! Followed recipe exactly minus the saffron. This recipe is a good base to be creative with. After it is done any sautéed or steamed vegetables could be added for an unlimited variety of flavor combinations. A good way to use up small amounts of left over veggies. I am going to have fun being creative with this recipe. Thanks Chef John!

I'm sorry, I have used this recipe countless times and never shared any praise.

This is a staple in our household.

A staple.

It's so easy, so tasty, and pairs well with nearly anything.

Sub beef stock for chicken?

BOOM, a hearty, dirty rice.

This is an amazing recipe and I am forever in your debt for sharing it.

One of the best, most flavorful simple rice recipes I've made. I already wrote it down and put it in my recipe book. Unfortunately I didn't have saffron but it was amazing without it. I will purchase some and use it next time for sure.
I love this recipe! I have yet to try it with saffron, but I finally bought some and plan to add it next time.
It was so so. Cooked perfectly. I just thought it was missing something. I will make it again but add something to tweak it.
I make this all the time. I up the chicken broth to 2 full cans and omit the saffron because we never own any. But we love it.
Easy to put together, I used bullion for lack of chicken-stock so I left out the salt. Still came out delicious!
Turned out perfectly

Full disclosure: While I did use the exact ingredients the recipe called for (opted not to use the saffron), I wasn't really keen on using multiple pieces of cookware just to make rice. I skipped the oven in favor of using one pot on the stove. I cooked the onion as directed, added the stock and seasonings to the same pot, brought it to a boil, added the rice and then covered and reduced to simmer until done. The rice tasted so good, perfectly fluffy, and flavorful! I have no idea how the oven would have changed things, but was happy with the final result.
Delicious!
This rice is great. Make it all the time, just have never added the saffron, but this recipe needs no changing.
I didn't have saffron, so I used turmeric. It was awesome. I was afraid it wasn't enough liquid, but it came out great.

First of all, my 18-year-old son loves rice-a-roni rice pilaf and he said this was better! I did this on the stove in one pan. I used the saffron. It was a gift and I was happy to finally use it! I used beef stock because I was out of chicken broth. I also browned the rice slightly before adding the broth and saffron. It was very tasty. I used seasoning salt instead of salt, as I usually do with everything! Thanks for the recipe. I'll be making it again and again.
I did not have saffron but other than that I made it exactly as directed. I was delicious and pretty simple. I'll save this one.
A new staple for me! This is great for leftovers as well! Thanks Chef John, your the best and so funny!

I made it in the rice cooker and used an extra cup of water (4 cups liquid total). I cooked everything but the rice and liquid in a pan first, then added it to the cooker once it was cooked, which saved time. It was quick and delicious!
No changes needed! Follow the recipe as is. This recipe comes out perfect every time. My guests have always complimented me and asked for the recipe.
This was a great recipe! I tried it and it was easy, tasty, and a big hit with our dinner guests. I will definitely make this again. I omitted the saffron.
I loved this !!! I did cut back on the salt but other than that, fantastic!

I loved this recipe. Might reduce the salt next time and not sure I needed the butter and oil to fry my onions...but overall it was great! Got lots of compliments from my family. Will definitely make it again!!
Omitted saffron. LOVED LOVED LOVED this! Very simple and SOOOO tasty!

this comes out great. I have made it several times and you can do all sorts of things with it. Make your on stock, use leftover drippings and other goodies. I tossed in some garlic cloves and diced carrots a few times.
Substituted saffron for sage and thyme and cayenne for paprika. Would make again. Worked out well. Light fluffy and not sticky at all.

I did not make any changes to this recipe but it did not cook as stated. I had to put the dish in the microwave for 20 minutes longer to cook the rice and absorb the liquid. Don't know what went wrong but followed the recipe exactly. Probably will not make this again.
I do cut this recipe in half since I usually am cooking for two; however, I feel this baking method is still warranted! Flavorful and fluffy rice every time.

Perfect recipe, love it. But i recommend the methods in this video for making the best rice, you won't regret it.

destyy.com/wbPIn3

This recipe is a crowd pleaser every time! However, I do have to turn the heat down for my crowd by skimping on the cayenne pepper a bit. Great flavor, great side dish, great for pot lucks. Thanks again, Chef John!

wonderful! I have trouble following recipes and this was no exception. I omitted the salt, and halved the stock and rice quantities. Because I had veggies in the fridge to use up, I diced zucchini, yellow pepper and mushrooms, added them to the onion, butter/oil mix just as it finished browning to just slightly soften and coat them. I then simmered no-salt chicken stock with chilli powder and cumin in the same pot I had used to saute the onions then poured it over the jasmine rice and veggies in a 7" wide square baking dish, covered with foil and followed the baking directions. The rice came out fluffy and tasted amazing! A perfect side dish to my roasted chicken thighs. Thanks for showing how to bake rice to perfection.
Used Jasmine rice... yummy!

I cook a lot of meals for our local homeless community, so making 3 huge steamers of rice (that's like nine 9x13's!) used to mean rice was in my hair, my ears, all over my kitchen by the time I made enough for 100 peeps ! This recipe has been A game changer and SO versatile. I make it "plain", I've made it 'spanish' adding tomatoes, chilies and balancing the liquids; add brocolli and chopped chicken (top with cheese while it rests), still plan to try adding some Red beans and some sausage for a meal version! THANK YOU for this one. OH and VERY IMPORTANT is to seal the pan- the steam cooks the rice ! I actually use heavyt duty plastic wrap as a first layer sealed THEN heavy duty foil (or the foil lids that come with disposable pans @ Sams) over that sealed tight. I know it sounds scary to put plastic wrap in the oven, but keep it under 350 degrees and it works - I PROMISE!
This recipe was fantastic!!! The entire family and friends really enjoyed this dish!! I have made it three times now. Thank you for such an enjoyable recipe. PB
Delicious!! I followed the recipe exactly and it came out perfect and I loved the flavor.
It was perfect! Will used many times over. Iceplant

Ok...so the rating came from my 7 yr old, who loves rice in almost any form. 

I followed the recipe, although I was a little concerned about the liquid to rice ratio. I didn't have peppers, but I had broccoli, which I added. No saffron, but I added tumeric to it instead. Everyone loved it! I was informed by the child to "please put carrots in next time!" So, that will be our change. I can see this being a "go to" recipe when we want something different. Thank you!
My favourite I like to add some mushrooms and chopped red peppers
I made this rice last night and we loved it. My 9 yr old does not like rice but he wanted more. I will be fixing this more often.
My husband totally loves this rice! It turns out perfect every time. We have used it for stir-fry, with pork chops and orange chicken. It is great with everything!

Well if we could screw up rice we did! We did the recipe as written except we used long grain brown rice. When we unwrapped it for the dinner, it was still floating in broth. We were very disappointed but I think that it was totally related to the fact that is was brown rice and also maybe not the best quality rice. We had to put it in a pot and bring it to a boil and let it simmer for about 20 minutes. Still crunchy but edible. Anyways, flavour was good and I will try again with better quality rice and long grain white rice.

I made this dish to go with bbq’d pork ribs and carrots. I had my mom over and her, my husband and I loved it! Mom asked me for the recipe. Very easy and I didn’t have the saffron the first time I made it but the second night I made another batch because I had so many ribs leftover and this time I added the saffron. Both ways were delicious! If I had to choose, I would add the saffron because it added a bit more flavour and a nice bit of colour to the dish. Thanks for providing me with an easy and quick side dish!
The addition of saffron made a huge flavor boost to this recipe!

Fantastic! I made it exactly to the recipe, and it ended up being the star of the meal. I didn't even care about the meat on my plate - this rice was delicious, and FOOL proof! I used basmati rice and every grain was separate and fluffy. I'll be making this 2-3x a month, for sure!
I screw up rice all the time. I omitted the salt and added 3.5 cups of chicken stock. IT is delicious!!!!!!!! It's absolutely perfect

Wow! This recipe and technique is simple yet perfect. I never thought to cook rice in the oven, but this is the best rice I ever made. My son and I both couldn't get enough. I omit the cayenne because my baby doesn't like spicy food, but I don't think the rice needed it anyways.

I make this exactly as the recipe states and it is our family favorite! This is perfect to make with berbecued meats, I can put it in the oven while I am grilling and the rice can sit for a few minutes without any harm.
